CONJUGATES: initials (noun plural, verb 3rd person singular) | initialing (verb present participle) | initialed (verb past tense/participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Latin initialis 'of the beginning', from initium 'beginning', from inire 'go into', from in- 'into' + ire 'go'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: a word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Existing or occurring at the beginning; first.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The initial symptoms of the disease are usually mild.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这种疾病的最初症状通常很轻微。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The first letter of a name or word. Often used in plural form to refer to the first letters of all parts of a person's full name.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （姓名或词的）首字母。常用于复数形式指人姓名的首字母缩写。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She signed the document with her initials, 'J.K.L.'.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她用她的首字母“J.K.L.”签了字。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that takes a direct object.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To mark or sign (a document) with one's initials, often as a sign of approval or verification.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用姓名首字母签名（表示批准或核实）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Please initial the changes you have made to the contract.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 请在您对合同所做的更改处签上您的首字母。
